course_title: Fresh Sem: Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies: Reproductive Rights & Justice
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(This course will survey legal and social questions around reproduction in the US, with a focus on contemporary questions of access to reproductive health care. Themes of reproductive justice, as well as disparate access to reproductive health as structured by race, location, age, nationality, sexuality, and gender identity will be central, as will be the spate of recent legal cases involving abortion, fetal personhood, embryo preservation, gender equality, and the separation of church and state. Finally, a comparative and transnational lens will introduce students to struggles and regimes of reproductive rights and justice elsewhere in the world.)
course_description: For first-year students only. Entry level seminar focusing on a specific topic.
